page.title: 05...SOCIAL CONCERNS
page.content: Several issues come under this heading. There are many retired and old people who need day centre care, home helps etc. to cater for their social and physical needs. Services which are dealing with these are very stretched. The area has many unemployed with little to do. When Y.O.P. schemes end many people are unemployed again. There are few facilities for the young apart from youth clubs and church run clubs. Children hang around buildings. A large part of the population consists of young single parents needing help from social services and provision for their children. More day care is needed for these children despite the play- groups, mother and toddler groups and nurseries which are available. Poor housing exists particularly in the flats in the area. Vandalism also gives cause for concern in the locality.
